title: Compact, premium header spacing and minimal landing page polish

requirements.summary: Make the global header more compact and visually balanced across breakpoints while keeping logo left and auth controls top-right.
acceptanceCriteria: On all common viewport widths (mobile, tablet, desktop), the header height/padding is slightly reduced compared to current, while maintaining comfortable spacing between logo and right-side controls.
Logo remains left-aligned, clickable, and navigates to `/`.
When unauthenticated, the "Log in" button stays visually anchored to the top-right area of the header; when authenticated, the user menu control stays in the same position.
Header maintains a light, modern look (subtle border/backdrop blur is acceptable) with no crowded elements or misalignment.

file_operations.description: Refine header layout spacing and sizing (slightly reduced height/padding, consistent gaps across breakpoints), keep left-aligned clickable logo routing to `/`, and keep right-side auth controls anchored consistently. Update the logo asset reference to the existing generated PNGs (use `frontend/public/assets/generated/vaani-logo-header.dim_240x64.png` with optional high-DPI `frontend/public/assets/generated/vaani-logo-header@2x.dim_480x128.png`) to avoid broken assets. Use shadcn-ui components (Button, DropdownMenu) to preserve consistent premium UI behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust global base styling for a cleaner premium feel (e.g., font smoothing, slightly refined default text rendering) while keeping the existing Tailwind/token approach and restrained neutral palette.

requirements.summary: Polish the Home (landing) page typography, whitespace, and alignment to a clean minimal premium style without changing structure/content.
acceptanceCriteria: Home page keeps the same components/sections (welcome heading + Creator Zone card) without adding new sections.
Visual hierarchy is improved: heading/subheading spacing, font sizes/weights, and max-width feel intentional and premium.
Colors are restrained (primarily neutrals); any accent color usage is subtle and does not dominate the page.
Alignment and spacing are consistent (container padding, vertical rhythm, and card placement look polished).

file_operations.description: Refine existing layout only (no new sections): adjust container max-width, vertical rhythm, and heading/subheading typography to feel more premium and whitespace-driven; keep the same welcome header and Creator Zone card placement.

If needed for consistent premium spacing/typography, extend Tailwind theme minimally (e.g., tuned container padding/typography defaults) while keeping the palette restrained and avoiding heavy accents.

requirements.summary: Polish the Creator Zone card visual presentation (spacing/typography/density) without altering submission behavior or adding features.
acceptanceCriteria: Creator Zone card header/content spacing is balanced and consistent with the refined landing page style.
Form controls retain current behavior (validation/toasts/submission) with no regressions.
No new fields, flows, or sections are introduced.

file_operations.description: Tighten and polish card header/content spacing, typography, and visual density while preserving all existing form behavior, validation/toasts, and submission. Use existing shadcn-ui components (Card, Button, Input, Label, Switch, Alert) to maintain consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Prepare a new deployed frontend build and update the deployment verification checklist to cover the header and landing page polish.
acceptanceCriteria: A new deployed build is produced after UI changes.
Deployment verification documentation includes at least a brief checklist confirming header spacing/alignment and Home page spacing/typography changes are visible in the live build.

file_operations.description: Update the checklist to include explicit verification items for: header compactness/breathing room across breakpoints, left logo click-to-home behavior, top-right auth control anchoring in both auth states, and Home page typography/whitespace/hierarchy polish being visible in the live build.
Update the redeploy script comments/steps (documentation-level) to remind reviewers to validate the new header spacing and Home/Creator Zone visual polish after deploying the updated frontend build.
